scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem:
The Greenford site has been earmarked to be mothballed from the first of January 2024. The plan is to keep the site functioning with the minimum services and equipment operational.  
At some stage, the internet and security Symmetry system will be turned off leading to security exposure after the badge readers go offline.
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and fit Screw In cylinder for front entrance door.
Supply G. Screws.
Supply Oval cylinder.
2 Keyed a-like keys
To Supply Each. Oval lock
Supply and fit 3 x Push Bar lock
2 x engineers to carry out the work.
scope_of_work.justification:
At some stage, the internet and security Symmetry system will be turned off leading to security exposure after the badge readers go offline.
One security personnel manning site during the day and night.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Security exposure after the badge readers go offline.
Possible breach if security locks are not replaced.

input.project_name: UPM-Hz - Kyndryl Warwick PH1 Powerhouse RPZ Valve Replacement
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
4. Although this is a fixed offer, it has the Horizon contract fee at 7%, and not the Sequoia contract fee at 6%.  The fee calculation will be adjusted prior to billing after the work is complete
scope_of_work.problem: RPZ valves are valves situated on Closed water systems that contain chemicals to prevent the chemicals getting back into the mains water supply. The valve that has failed is situated on the fill to our PH1 CHW System within the PH1A Powerhouse. If the pressure drops in the CHW system then water is automatically added via the pressurisation sets and this RPZ Valve prevents any chemical back feeding into the water system if a top up is required. These Valves are reportable through the Water Regulator (Severn Trent)
scope_of_work.scope: The RPZ valve within the PH1 Powerhouse at Warwick has failed. 1.RPZ Valve to be isolated from the water supply so that it can be removed, 2.Modification of pipework to allow for RPZ Valve to be installed, 3.New RPZ Valve to be installed at correct height in place of failed valve, 4.RPZ to be confirmed in position, 5.RPZ Valve to be retested and pass completion certificate to be issued to CBRE
scope_of_work.justification: If this valve is not replaced there is a risk that the water within our closed water systems on site could enter the mains water stream as there is no valve preventing this from happening with this RPZ Valve out of action. Unlikely in this setup however these valves are registered with Severn Trent therefore remedial action is required to close out the issue
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: These valves are registered with the water regulator which is Severn Trent for the Warwick area. They are aware of this issue and will require remedial action to get this valve replaced, if this valve is not replaced then they would want to see this water supply disconnected which would prevent us being able to top up our critical closed water systems on site

input.associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

output.overview: Project 'UPM-Hz - Kyndryl Warwick PH1 Powerhouse RPZ Valve Replacement' is located in United Kingdom at site N/A, managed by Qwerty for client Kyndryl. Prepared by Jayme Feil under internal work order UK-EW-24012024-6363. Current status is 'Cancelled'.
output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
4. Although this is a fixed offer, it has the Horizon contract fee at 7%, and not the Sequoia contract fee at 6%.  The fee calculation will be adjusted prior to billing after the work is complete. The problem statement indicates: RPZ valves are valves situated on Closed water systems that contain chemicals to prevent the chemicals getting back into the mains water supply. The valve that has failed is situated on the fill to our PH1 CHW System within the PH1A Powerhouse. If the pressure drops in the CHW system then water is automatically added via the pressurisation sets and this RPZ Valve prevents any chemical back feeding into the water system if a top up is required. These Valves are reportable through the Water Regulator (Severn Trent). The defined scope of work includes: The RPZ valve within the PH1 Powerhouse at Warwick has failed. 1.RPZ Valve to be isolated from the water supply so that it can be removed, 2.Modification of pipework to allow for RPZ Valve to be installed, 3.New RPZ Valve to be installed at correct height in place of failed valve, 4.RPZ to be confirmed in position, 5.RPZ Valve to be retested and pass completion certificate to be issued to CBRE. The justification provided is: If this valve is not replaced there is a risk that the water within our closed water systems on site could enter the mains water stream as there is no valve preventing this from happening with this RPZ Valve out of action. Unlikely in this setup however these valves are registered with Severn Trent therefore remedial action is required to close out the issue. If not approved, the effect would be: These valves are registered with the water regulator which is Severn Trent for the Warwick area. They are aware of this issue and will require remedial action to get this valve replaced, if this valve is not replaced then they would want to see this water supply disconnected which would prevent us being able to top up our critical closed water systems on site.
output.status_history: First, cancelled by Bilal. Then, sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil.

input.project_name: UPM-NHB Lightning Protection System remedial works
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):rejected by Neil Hauck (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (3):work in progress by Eryn Reichert

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process 
4. Although this is a fixed offer, it has the Horizon contract fee at 7%, and not the Sequoia contract fee at 6%.  The fee calculation will be adjusted prior to billing after the work is complete
scope_of_work.problem: The North Harbour Lightning Protection System annual maintenance has been completed and multiple remedial works have been identified as required.
scope_of_work.scope: Various as identified by 3rd party specialist quotation 'QSTO150675'.
scope_of_work.justification:
Works required to meet the recommendations in the current 
industry standard - BS EN 62305 ‘Protection Against Lightning’. This includes the provision 
for Electrical and Electronic Systems Protection also referred to as Surge Protection Devices 
(SPDs). These SPDs provide protection from indirect strikes and the secondary effects of direct 
strikes to or near the structure.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Inability to meet the recommendations in the current 
industry standard - BS EN 62305 ‘Protection Against Lightning’.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The Warwick Hub kitchen area which includes 2 dishwashers, 2 fridges, 2 microwaves, sink, seating areas with fixed tables and work surfaces. The area is cleaned once a day by the site cleaning team, outside of the daily clean consumables and cleaning products have been funded by individuals to keep the dishwashers running and appliances clean.
scope_of_work.scope: Purchase of cleaning consumables, to be held by the Warwick cleaning team in a lockable cupboard with a small amount held in the Hub for daily use., cleaning team to monitor usage and top up the Hub when required.

input.project_name: UPM-NHB - UPS A Cooling System Repairs
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
The cooling system supporting UPS A has developed operational faults that require rectification to restore the system to full availability.
Note: 2x coolers installed, currently only 1x cooler available
scope_of_work.scope: 3rd party specialist (Stulz) to supply and install 1x replacement IOC Controller board and 1x replacement EC Fan.
scope_of_work.justification: The cooling system for UPS A is currently operating with reduced availability. If the remaining available cooler fails there is an increased risk of the failure of UPS A.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Continued increased risk of the failure of UPS A.

input.project_name: UPM-DRUPS 2 Abnormal Noise Running on Diesel
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: During the quarterly 1 hour DRUPS 2 load run on diesel in January there was an abnormal hunting noise from the engine after 30 minutes
scope_of_work.scope:
Investigate with specialists and resolution.
Engine specialist alongside DRUPS OEM to attend site so that unit can be interrogated using systems software. Replacement part of engine controller to be supplied by specialist
scope_of_work.justification: The DRUPS 2 diesel engine provides emergency standby power to CSA, CSD & Spine Room Suites in the event of a Mains failure
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increase risk of engine failure when in diesel operation
